intro: Linosyris drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's linseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It has a basal rosette of leaves and short, upright flowering stems. Linosyris drummondii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
